projects.name: Tune Tailor
projects.subtitle: A Desktop-Focused Application to Simplify Liked Songs Modifications for Spotify User's
projects.description: As an avid music listener, one way or another I managed to accumulate over 11,000 liked songs on my Spotify Account. With a desire to clean up my liked songs to reflect my current music tastes and no simple, efficient way to do so through Spotify, the idea for Tune Tailor was born. The application utilizes the MERN stack and leverages the Spotify API to allow Spotify Users to make mass additions and deletions to their liked songs via their top tracks (as recognized by Spotify) and songs within their playlists.
projects.abstract: A solo software project which strives to provide a cleaner interface for making modification to Spotify Liked Songs. The project utilizes Tailwind, React Router and the MERN stack alongside the Spotify API as a means of achieving this functionality.

projects.name: Polymorphia
projects.subtitle: An Object-Oriented Interactive Game Developed in Java via TDD
projects.abstract: An object-oriented game built in Java. The game features a maze consisting of a varying number of rooms, adventurers, creatures, and items. Development of the game was driven through testing via JUnit and expansions to the game provided opportunities to refactor and implement object-oriented design patterns to simplify complexity.

projects.name: Portland Indigenous Marketplace Project
projects.subtitle: A Mobile Focused Application to Improve Vendor and Event Management for Portland Indigenous Marketplace
projects.abstract: The Portland Indigenous Marketplace Project is a mobile-focused application developed using React.js, React Router, Express.js, Node.js, and PostgreSQL. Through these technologies, we sought to deliver a consolidated platform to the executives of the Portland Indigenous Marketplace non profit to improve their ability to manage vendors and events. The project is one amongst several projects created through the Blueprint Boulder organization.

projects.name: Palette5
projects.subtitle: An Art-Focused Software Application
projects.abstract: A group software project which sought to immerse themselves in the art world through discovery, events, and artist related pages. The application utilized Bootstrap, Handlebars.js, Express.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL to deliver dynamically rendered content, handle external API calls, and execute database operations.

projects.name: Cook County Data Science Project
projects.subtitle: Investigating Cook County Housing Data to Form Predictive Models
projects.abstract: With a history of racial discrimination in housing policy and property taxation, the project sought to explore over 500,000 housing records in Cook County, Illinois. The exploration of the dataset culminated in the creation of several linear regression models to more accurately predict home prices within the county.

projects.name: Goudy Type Specimen
projects.subtitle: An Exhibition of the Typeface Goudy Old Style
projects.abstract: Designed using Adobe Illustrator, the Goudy Type Specimen seeks to provide an aesthetically pleasing presentation of the typeface Goudy Old Style designed by Frederic W. Goudy. The type specimen displays the core of the typeface, exhbiting all characters A-Z and 0-9 alongside several notable characters outside this grouping.

projects.name: Typographic Calendar
projects.subtitle: A 2025 Calendar Inspired by the Record Player
projects.abstract: Title Track 2025, our typographic calendar emphasizes the continuous motion of time underscored by record players. Each month represents a side of the record where the typographic-focused design centered around qualities of the respective month.
